intro: Silene ibosii, commonly known as the Ibos's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Ethiopian highlands. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, humid conditions. Silene ibosii is a herbaceous perennial with a short stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
